definitions.definition: intensity or the act of becoming intense .
Any property or quality connoted by a word, phrase or other symbol, contrasted with actual instances in the real world to which the term applies.
examples: 'Is a plant', 'has a trunk', 'has leaves' are intensions of the concept tree . Its extension is the set of all trees existing in the real world.

definitions.definition: A straining, stretching, or bending; the state of being strained.
examples: the intension of a musical string

main_definition: intensity or the act of becoming intense .
secondary_definitions: ( logic , semantics ) Any property or quality connoted by a word, phrase or other symbol, contrasted with actual instances in the real world to which the term applies.
( dated ) A straining, stretching, or bending; the state of being strained.
